intro: Berkheya arctiifolia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid conditions. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, cylindrical seed heads. Berkheya arctiifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
